intro: Silene permixta, commonly known as the mixed-silene or the redstem sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low, sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Silene permixta is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a hardy species in its native range.
